text:
This means that if we were to take all possible samples of size 30 from the Iowa farm
worker population and prepare a sampling distribution of the sample means, we
would get a distribution with a mean of $13.50 and standard error of $0.53.
Practically speaking, the population's standard deviation is almost never known. Instead,
the standard error of the sample mean must be estimated by dividing the standard
deviation of the sample mean by vn:
